Class oracle.html.DynamicTable

Class oracle.html.DynamicTable 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.html.Item
           |
           +----oracle.html.Table
                   |
                   +----oracle.html.DynamicTable
public class DynamicTable
extends Table
Description:

Dynamic Table encapsulates a dynamically growable table It mimics HTML authoring by allowing operations like addRow() to be applied to a DynamicTable Object.

Instructions:

Creating a table generally involves the following steps:

  1. Create a DynamicTable object
  2. Create a TableRow object for each row in the table
  3. Create either a TableDataCell object or TableHeaderCell object for each cell in a row.
  4. Add cells to each row by using the addCell method
  5. Add All rows to the table by using the addRow method

Example: 

// Some user-defined functions
Product product = getFirstProduct();
// create a dynamic table with 2 columns
DynamicTable tab = new DynamicTable(2);
// create the rows and add them to the table
TableRow rows[] = new TableRow[NUM_ROWS];
for (int i=0; i< NUM_ROWS; i++) {
  // allocate TableRow
  rows[i] = new TableRow();
  // populate row with data 
  rows[i].addCell(new TableHeaderCell(product.getProductID()))
         .addCell(new TableDataCell(product.getProductDescription()))
  // add them to Table 
  tab.addRow(rows[i]);
}
See Also:
Table, FixedTable, TableRow, TableDataCell, TableHeaderCell

DynamicTable(int)
Constructs a DynamicTable object

addRow(TableRow)
Adds a row to this table using a TableRow.
addRow()
Adds a new row to this table.
addRow(int)
add the specified number of new rows to this table
getNumRows()
Returns the current number of rows in this DynamicTable.
print()
print content (as HTML) to System.out
setCellAt(int, int, SimpleItem)
Sets the content of a particular cell at a specified position.
Note that the previous item at the position is discarded.
toHTML()
Returns content of this DynamicTable as HTML String
toString()
Returns content of this Dynamic Table as regular string
Assumptions:
  1. No cell with COLSPAN or ROWSPAN attribute > 1
  2. All rows have the same number of cells

DynamicTable 
  public DynamicTable(int cols)
Constructs a DynamicTable object
Parameters:
cols - specifies number of columns in this table

Returns the current number of rows in this DynamicTable.

                                int row_num,
                                SimpleItem item)
Sets the content of a particular cell at a specified position.
Note that the previous item at the position is discarded.
Parameters:
col_num - specifies the column number (cell count)
row_num - specifies the row number
item - specifies the item to be set at the position
